meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; to make uneasy or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise unsettles the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news unsettles her before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog unsettles the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming in the sky unsettle the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the abandoned house unsettles anyone who enters.

meanings.definition: To cause to become disordered or disarranged.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind unsettles the neatly arranged papers on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous toddler unsettles the carefully set table.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy unsettles the perfectly made bed.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake unsettles the carefully stacked books on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy dancer unsettles the formation of the group.

meanings.definition: To cause to be uncertain or in doubt.
meanings.sent1: The conflicting information unsettles his decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious letter unsettles her belief in coincidences.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks unsettle the audience's perception of reality.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist unsettles the viewers' predictions.
meanings.sent5: The unanswered questions in the mystery novel unsettle the readers' assumptions.
